question.title: AuthDecisionStatementBean.setEvidence object type in wss4j java package
question.body:
I am trying to instantiate an AuthDecisionStatementBean using org.apache.wss4j 2.3.0. What type of object do you put into setEvidence method? The documentation says to put type Object which is not very helpful...

ActionBean action = new ActionBean();
action.setActionNamespace("urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.0:action:rwedc");
action.setContents("Execute");

AuthDecisionStatementBean authDecisionStatementData = new AuthDecisionStatementBean();
authDecisionStatementData.setDecision(AuthDecisionStatementBean.Decision.PERMIT);
authDecisionStatementData.setResource("");
authDecisionStatementData.setActions(List.of(action));
authDecisionStatementData.setEvidence(<what do you put here>);

answers.body:
AttributeBean roleAttribute = new AttributeBean();
roleAttribute.setSimpleName("role");
roleAttribute.setAttributeValues(List.of("admin"));

AttributeStatementBean attributeStatement = new AttributeStatementBean();
attributeStatement.setSamlAttributes(List.of(roleAttribute));

AssertionBean evidenceAssertion = new AssertionBean(); 
evidenceAssertion.setAttributeStatements(List.of(attributeStatement)); 
// A assertion would also have a subject, issuer, conditions, etc.
// evidenceAssertion.setIssuer("urn:example:idp"); 
// evidenceAssertion.setSubject(new SubjectBean(...));

EvidenceBean evidenceBean = new EvidenceBean();
evidenceBean.setAssertions(List.of(evidenceAssertion));

authDecisionStatementData.setEvidence(evidenceBean);

The object hierarchy directly mirrors the SAML XML structure:

  • AuthDecisionStatementBean maps to <saml:AuthorizationDecisionStatement>

  • EvidenceBean you pass to .setEvidence() maps to <saml:Evidence> element inside it

  • AssertionBean you put inside EvidenceBean maps to <saml:Assertion> element inside <saml:Evidence> block
